snippet: In an evolutionary twist, a study has found that the shape of crocodilian muzzles has no effect on bite force.
abstract: Florida State University researcher Greg Erickson study published in journal PLoS One finds that the force of a crocadilian's bite increases with the size of the animal, not the proportions of the head and snout, as previously thought.
lead_paragraph: In an evolutionary twist, a study has found that the shape of crocodilian muzzles has no effect on bite force.

headline.seo: Broad or Dainty, Crocodile Snouts Pack Same Chomp
headline.main: Broad or Dainty, Crocodilian Snouts Pack Same Chomp
headline.print_headline: Broad or Dainty, Crocodilian Snouts Pack Same Chomp
